newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ramos sister endorsed as presidential bet.
newsitem.headline: Ramos sister endorsed as presidential bet.

text.p: A faction of Philippine President Fidel Ramos's party on Sunday endorsed his sister, Senator Leticia Ramos-Shahani, as its candidate in the 1998 presidential elections, throwing the race for his successor wide open.
Shahani, a former diplomat, was the fifth senior member of the administration to declare her intention to run in the June 1998 polls.

The others are Vice-President and ex-movie star Joseph Estrada, Lower House Speaker Jose de Venecia, Defence Secretary Renato de Villa and Finance Secretary Roberto de Ocampo, who announced his bid on Saturday.
Estrada, who enjoys huge popular appeal, belongs to an opposition coalition. De Venecia, de Villa and de Ocampo are colleagues of Shahani in the administration's Lakas party.
They are among a dozen politicians who have expressed interest in the presidency.
Ramos is constitutionally barred from seeking re-election but a group of supporters has launched a signature campaign to scrap term limits on incumbent officials so he can also join the fray.
Shahani, addressing a meeting of the Lakas-Tao faction which backed her bid, pledged to pursue his brother's reform programme.
"If we lose in the elections, all the achievements we have realised in the past five years will go to oblivion," she said.
